definition: to promote a martial spirit/to revere military skills/warlike

sentences.english: The US is not a warrior culture.
sentences.chinese: 美國文化並非是尚武文化。

sentences.english: Must the spirit which esteems martial arts, integrates to the attractive movement.
sentences.chinese: 要把尚武的精神，融入到好看的動作當中。

sentences.english: To deeds of arms the martial spirit fired.
sentences.chinese: 吟唱戰爭偉業和尚武精神。

sentences.english: They quickly retreat back to Ono Naotake report.
sentences.chinese: 他們趕緊後撤回來報告給小野尚武。

sentences.english: Despite his veneration of violence, Yongle sought to defang certain parts of Ming society.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他尚武，永樂帝還是削弱了明朝社會的某些部分。

definition: to value letters and belittle arms (idiom); to stress civil matters and neglect the military/to prefer the pen to the sword
to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
bushidō or way of the warrior, samurai code of chivalry
chivalrous/helping the weak for the sake of justice
common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian
